explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Since the melting point, boiling point, the flash point, etc. are measured at the temperature of 70 degC or more (ICSC (J) (1994) etc.), the ignition point is judged to be 70 degC or more.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on rat LD50 = 604.8 mg/kg obtained by applying the calculation formula to LD50 value of the rat 4 examinations (545, 900, 940, and 1832 mg/kg) (DFGOT vol.11 (1998) and CERI Hazard Data (2002)), it was set as Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is a report of one examination case. But there is no statement on such as the strength of a stimulus. So it cannot be classified because of insufficient data.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2B based on the slight stimulative statement (CERI Hazard Data (2002)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Category1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: (Respiratory sensitization)-; (Skin sensitization)May cause allergic skin reaction
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: No data. ; Skin sensitization: Classified as Category 1 because several patch tests in humans and the Maximization Test using guinea pigs result positive (DFGOT vol.11 (1998)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance was regarded as outside the categories by the technical guidelines. Because the result of the dominant lethal test using mice is negative (CERI Hazard Data (2002)), and the in vivo mutagenicity tests (several micronucleus tests using mice or rats) are negative as well (IARC 79 (2001)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the category of IARC (2001): 3, it was set as the outside of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since there were the increase of resorpted embryo, the reduction of brain weigt of embryo and the denaturation of tubule with dose not affecting maternal animal in rabbit organogenetic period administration test (DFGOT vol.11(1998)), and there were malformation od skeltal system, central nerve system and lung, adding to the dose-independent increase of the dead and reduction of weight of embryo with the dose not affecting to maternal animals in hamster (DFGOT vol.11 (1998)), it is classified into the Category 1B. There is the existing classifications of EU Annex 1: Repr.Cat.2;R61.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (thyroid gland, kidneys) through prolonged or repeated exposure;May cause damage to organs (pituitary) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It is stated that the thyroid is the main target organ in mouse and especialy rat (DFGOT vol.11 (1998)). Since follicle cell hyperplasia, vacuolation of the thyroid gland, and the quantitative alteration of hormone, and vacuolation of tubular epithelial cells and edema were observed in kidney in rat with the given dose of the Category 1 guidance value range (DFGO vol.11 (1998) CERI hazard data (2002)), they were classified into Category 1 (thyroid gland and kidney). Moreover, since vacuolation of the pituicyte was observed with the given dose of the Category 2 guidance value range (DFGOT vol.11 (1998)), it was classified into Category 2 (pituitary).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 48-hour EC50=13.3mg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 3, since acute toxicity was Category 3 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 0% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (BCF=0.3 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).
